intro: Chusquea mollis, commonly known as the silky tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to South America. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnate fronds. The plant produces spores on the undersides of its fronds, which are typically found in moist, shaded environments. It has a slow growth rate and can live for several decades, making it a long-lived plant in its natural habitat. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening in temperate climates.
